instructions: Tap the Settings app. Tap Cellular (on older versions of iOS, tap Phone ). Tap Wi-Fi Calling . Turn on the Wi-Fi Calling on This iPhone toggle switch. Follow the onscreen prompts to add your physical location. This information is used so that emergency services can locate you if you call 911. The E911 information screen identifies your home location. It does not automatically send your current location if you dial 911 away from your home. Wi-Fi Calling is enabled and ready to use.
